name: Ralph Flambard
summary: Ralph Flambard was Bishop of Durham from 1099 to 1128. He was a key administrator under William the Conqueror and William Rufus, serving as the chief financial officer. He was known for his administrative skills and was instrumental in organizing the Domesday Book survey. He was imprisoned by Henry I but later released. His career illustrates the close relationship between church and state in Norman England.
